section1.title: Accountability obligation
section1.desc: Accountability is a key principle requiring organizations to demonstrate how they comply with the Data Protection Act. This includes taking technical and organizational measures and proving effectiveness.

section2.item1: Adequate documentation on what personal data is processed.
section2.item2: How, to what purpose, and how long data will be processed for.
section2.item3: Documented processes and procedures for early-stage data protection and breach response.
section2.item4: The presence of a Data Protection Officer (if required) involved in planning and operations.
